entry.title: Re: Use of Campaign orders in Process industry - PCA1
entry.content:
From your post, what I could understand the purpose of Campaign Order is that

  • Used to collect overhead costs like cleaning, setup, and changeover.
  • Created without a material to isolate non-product-specific costs.
  • Later, these costs are settled to actual process orders (e.g., ZI01).

You can add process orders and planned orders, even from multiple materials. Campaign scheduling adjusts to cover all included orders. Planned orders added via ‚ÄúCreate Planned Order‚Äù are included in the campaign window but retain their own MRP scheduling.

Confirming ZI02 (via button or COR6N) records actual labor/machine time. Ensures accurate cost tracking and supports proper settlement.

Costs from ZI02 are transferred to ZI01 using a settlement rule. This can be automated using standard SAP settlement jobs (e.g., KO88).

You can include PM/QM orders if configured in the same order group. Cost collectors are better for continuous overhead tracking, but not campaign-style grouping.

entry.title: SAC Story - use dropdown for Dimension Property
entry.content:
I am using an SAC Story on top of a planning model.

I am wanting to add a dropdown widget for ‚ÄúCountry‚Äù ‚Äì which is the property of dimension ‚ÄúPlant‚Äù.

The below code, which was added to onInititalization of a page, successfully adds ‚ÄúPlant‚Äù members to a dropdown list and defaults to ‚ÄúA001‚Äù.

I am now wanting to change the below code to now instead add members of the property ‚ÄúCountry‚Äù.

But I am not finding the correct API/functions/code to use.

I have found some blogs online but they all relate to using an Analytic Application and not a Story.

Can someone please help with the script?

Thanks

Anton

var dimPlant = Table_1.getDataSource().getMembers("Plant");
for( var i = 0; i< dimPlant.length; i++ )
	{
		Dropdown_Plant.addItem(dimPlant [i].id, dimPlant [i].description);
	}

Dropdown_Plant.setSelectedKey("A001");

entry.title: Availability Check for Components in Default Storage Location (External Procurement) in SAP PP-PI
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I‚Äôm working in SAP PP-PI and have the following business requirement:

We want to perform a material availability check for components in the Process Order, but not in the production storage location.
Instead, we need the check to run in the default storage location for external procurement (LGFSB) ‚Äî the main storage location where materials are initially stored before being issued to production.

Business Requirement:
Before releasing an order, the client needs to verify that components are available in the main storage location (LGFSB), not in the production supply location.

Questions:

  1. Is there a transaction that can perform availability check specifically for the LGFSB storage location?

  2. Is there any user exit / BAdI that could allow overriding the storage location used in the availability check?

  3. Any tips or tricks for configuring or customizing this behavior in PP-PI?

Any guidance, best practices, or workarounds would be greatly appreciated.

SAP S/4HANA  MAN Production Planning (PP)  MM (Materials Management)  SAP S/4HANA for advanced ATP 

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Re: SAC Story - use dropdown for Dimension Property
entry.content:
@antonclv19 

The new stories support scripting which means they are same as analytic applications. You can try some script like below. I assume COUNTRY is property of dimension Plant. Adjust as per you attribute name.

var dimPlant = Table_1.getDataSource().getMembers("Plant");
var CountrymemberId = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);

for( var i = 0; i< dimPlant.length; i++ )
	{
		
		var currentcountry = dimPlant[i].properties.COUNTRY;
		if(CountrymemberId.indexOf(currentcountry) === -1 && currentcountry)
			{
			   CountrymemberId.push(currentcountry);
			   Dropdown_Country.addItem(currentcountry);
			}
	}

Dropdown_Country.setSelectedKey("C001");

 

 

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Availability Check for Components in Default Storage...
entry.content:
The standard behavior in SAPPP-PI is that SAP typically checks component availability at the storage location assigned in the process order (often the production supply location). If no storage location is specified, the check defaults to plant-level stock. LGFSB is stored in the MRP2 view of the material master and used during purchase requisition creation, not necessarily during availability checks.

So what you can do is assign LGFSB as the Component Storage Location. In your BOM or recipe, assign LGFSB as the default storage location for components. Alternatively, use production version or routing/recipe to specify LGFSB explicitly.

Adjust Availability Check Scope in SPRO ‚Üí Production ‚Üí Shop Floor Control ‚Üí Operations ‚Üí Availability Check. There Define Scope of Check (transaction OPJJ). Ensure it includes storage location-level stock and not just plant-level. You can exclude the production supply location by setting its MRP indicator to ‚Äò1‚Äô (excluded from MRP and ATP).

Use Checking Control in SPRO ‚Üí Production ‚Üí Shop Floor Control ‚Üí Operations ‚Üí Availability Check ‚Üí Define Checking Control. There Set up a checking rule for your order type and plant. Ensure it triggers the check at order release and uses the correct scope.

To override the storage location dynamically during availability check, you can try with BAdI: WORKORDER_UPDATE with which, you can inject LGFSB as the storage location for components before the check runs.

i give here a short example but this thing is complicate me everytime i need to to calculation that in the measure there is null and not 0
i need a way (script or data action to replace null with 0)

I have dimension cost center

Measure 1 - is valid (can be 1 or null -)

entry.title: Re: Data Action and null
entry.content:
@daniel_weisblut86 

i need a way (script or data action to replace null with 0) -  Never attempt this as this is not advisable and will clog your system with unwanted 0's and create performance issues.

The data action need to calculate Bud 2026 as 
Act 2025 * Measure 1

Measure 1 can be null or 1

Other way of interpreting this is in 2 steps

Bud26= Actual 25 * 0.0  // This will make Actual 25 data as 0 and assign to Bud26

Bud26=Actual25* Measure 1 // Some 0 records from above will be overwritten wherever Measure 1 will exist 

 

Either you can have Measure1 as 1 and 0 explicitly instead of 1 and null or do it in 2 steps as above.

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Blog It Forward ‚Äì Marla Alschweiki
entry.content:
I‚Äôm happy to join the Blog It Forward ‚Äì The Sequel challenge and share a bit about myself and my SAP journey.

About Me

I started my SAP career over 8 years ago as a software developer and later specialized in SAP Data Analytics, AI, and intelligent applications. Today, I work as a Senior Data & AI Development Consultant at PwC, focusing on SAP AI Core, SAP BDC, SAP S/4HANA Data Analytics, RAP, and Fiori/UI5 development.

I‚Äôm passionate about contributing to the SAP Community, sharing knowledge, and taking part in events like SAP TechEd. When I‚Äôm not working, I‚Äôm usually with my puppy Carlo, exploring the nature around us, or joining Carlo in a new adventure outdoors.üê∂üòÅ

 

 

Fun Fact

I live in a small but lively city in Germany, surrounded by nature yet well-connected to the tech community. Germany is home to more than 25,000 castles and palaces, many tucked away in small towns and forests, perfect for weekend exploration.

Answering Some Blog It Forward Questions

If I were 20 again, what would I study?
I‚Äôd still choose technology all over again, but I would add more AI and data science earlier in my studies.

Describe in one short sentence: ‚ÄúWhat need does your SAP solution meet‚Äù?
I design solutions that turn data into actionable insights, making processes smarter and decisions faster.

What‚Äôs the best lesson you‚Äôve learned?
To work hard, stay true to myself, and keep learning every day.

Five Things I Want to Achieve

  • See the Northern Lights  üåå
  • Help rescued pets find homes üê∂
  • Publish a book about AI and SAP üìò
  • pay it forward and mentor young tech professionals üë©‚Äçüíª
  • Live by the sea üåä

Blogging It Forward

I‚Äôd like to blog it forward to:

  • @TammyPowlas  for her great experience as a SAP mentor 

  • @Vitaliy-Rfor her inspiring work in SAP development

My questions for you:

  1. What‚Äôs one SAP skill you wish you had learned earlier?

  2. If you could combine any SAP technology with AI, what would you build?

#BIF #Blogitforward

entry.title: Easy way to move zeroes in SAP BTP ABAP(Steampunk), JS & Python
entry.content:
Introduction

This is part of the Easy way to write algorithms in ABAP: Series 01. For more algorithms, please check the main blog-post.

Problem

Given an integer array nums, move all 0's to the end of it while maintaining the relative order of the non-zero elements.

Note that you must do this in-place without making a copy of the array.

Example 1:

Input: nums = [0,1,0,3,12]
Output: [1,3,12,0,0]

Example 2:

Input: nums = [0]
Output: [0]

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 104
  • -231 <= nums[i] <= 231 - 1

Follow up: Could you minimize the total number of operations done?

Solution

Time Complexity: O(n)
Space Complexity: O(1)

ABAP

CLASS zmove_zeroes DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC .

  PUBLIC SECTION.
    INTERFACES if_oo_adt_classrun.

  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    " Define a table type for integers
    TYPES ty_nums TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i WITH EMPTY KEY.

    " Method to move zeroes in-place
    METHODS moveZeroes
      CHANGING lt_nums TYPE ty_nums.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS zmove_zeroes IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD if_oo_adt_classrun~main.
    " Initialize the number array with some zeroes and non-zeroes
    DATA(lt_nums) = VALUE ty_nums( ( 0 ) ( 1 ) ( 0 ) ( 3 ) ( 12 ) ).

    " Output the array before moving zeroes
    out->write( |Array before moving zeroes: | ).
    LOOP AT lt_nums INTO DATA(lv_num).
      out->write( lv_num ).
    ENDLOOP.

    " Call the method to move zeroes to the end
    moveZeroes( CHANGING lt_nums = lt_nums ).

    " Output the array after moving zeroes
    out->write( |Array after moving zeroes: | ).
    LOOP AT lt_nums INTO lv_num.
      out->write( lv_num ).
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD moveZeroes.

    DATA(lv_count) = 0. " Counter for non-zero elements

    " First pass: Move all non-zero elements to the front
    LOOP AT lt_nums ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lf_num>).
      IF <lf_num> <> 0.
        " Place the non-zero element at the next available position
        lt_nums[ lv_count + 1 ] = <lf_num>.
        lv_count += 1.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Second pass: Fill the rest of the array with zeroes
    WHILE lv_count < lines( lt_nums ).
      lt_nums[ lv_count + 1 ] = 0.
      lv_count += 1.
    ENDWHILE.

  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

JavaScript

function moveZeroes(nums) {
    let left = 0;
    for (let right = 0; right < nums.length; right++) {
        if (nums[right] !== 0) {
            // Swap nums[left] and nums[right]
            let temp = nums[left];
            nums[left] = nums[right];
            nums[right] = temp;
            left++;
        }
    }
    return nums;
}

 

Python

def moveZeroes(nums):
    left = 0
    for right in range(len(nums)):
        if nums[right] != 0:
            nums[left], nums[right] = nums[right], nums[left]
            left += 1
    return nums

 

N.B: For ABAP, I am using SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2309 Release.

Happy Coding! üôÇ

entry.title: Re: I want "Display line item in general ledger" report f...
entry.content:
Hello @JabinRubayat 

In SAP S4 Public cloud, the Display Line Items in General Ledger app (Fiori app ID F2217) lacks a direct send by Email button for report output. However, you can still accomplish this by using one of the following methods below;

Export and send manually

  • Run the report in the Display Line Items in General Ledger app.
  • Use the Export ‚Üí Spreadsheet / PDF option.
  • Send the exported file via your email client.

Use the Schedule Accounts app for automated output

  • Open the app Schedule General Ledger Jobs or Schedule Jobs F1702
  • Select a job template for Display Line Items in General Ledger or related CDS view query.
  • Set output format to Spreadsheet or PDF.
  • In job parameters, choose Send by Email and specify recipient addresses.
  • Schedule it periodically or as a one-off.

Create a custom report in Custom Analytical Queries

  • CDS view: C_GLLineItemRawData or I_JournalEntryItem.
  • Build a query with the same selection logic as the Display Line Items app.
  • Add the query to View Browser or Analytics.
  • Use Schedule Publication in the Fiori Launchpad to send the results by email automatically.

Let me know if it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: DI API Problem Class COM with SAP Business One Application
entry.content:
Hello !

I share with you the solution found for a problem that i had while creating an application that communiquates with SAP Business One.

The problem (error) was :

While creating a solution for a client, requiring a connection to the SAP system, we encountered the following issue:The app is generated in 64-bit, but if SAP DIAPI 32 is installed, it points to it, resulting in a COM class error. If DIAPI 32 is not installed, the application points to 64 and works normally!
üîπ The application is correctly compiled in 64-bit.
üîπ We want to install the 32-bit DI API (in addition to the 64-bit), which is necessary for launching certain add-ons. However, when it is installed, the app crashes because it automatically connects to the 32-bit DI API instead of the 64-bit one.
üëâ Result: COM error (Class not registered, Retrieving the COM class factory failed, etc.) when both versions are installed, even though the app is 64-bit.

 

Please find the solution in the following post : https://www.linkedin.com/posts/tarik-bentayeb-5a81501bb_solution-pour-un-probl%C3%A8me-di-api-sap-b1-activity-7360321854651125760-WAqv?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android&rcm=ACoAADMZ1FAB2YZRL7QaWU7ODUDS4cddMYfS2HE

 

SAP Business One

entry.title: Re: Project Systems, Clear information on BoQs
entry.content:
In SAP there isn't an explicit object called a Bill of Quantities.  The cost estimate (BoQ) for a construction project can be represented in SAP with a PS Project Cost Plan using Network Activities and Components.  You can also use Unit Costing on WBS elements to represent the BoQ.

SAP has an object called a Bill on Materials (BOM) but that is material only.

entry.title: Re: Can OpenSSL in Crystal Reports 2025 be an install opt...

SAP Crystal Reports 2025 Security Assessment Results
from
US Dept of Air Force
Software and Application Certification Assessment (SACA)

Hi Don...

The OpenSSL was a very critical concern and, a determiner to moving forward with remaining SACA process for Approved Products List certification. I forwarded your support statement/ message to the AF SACA team and was acceptable.  Therefore, below is a summary of the remaining items found in the AF security assessment testing. Each heading contains details of the security concern and, mitigation. Please provide a response to SAP capability to provide the associated mitigation... Thank you

Unsupported Open-Source Software (OSS)

Mitigation: These unsupported files need an OSS support statement (like previous email/message for OpenSSL) or, will need to be removed or upgraded within installation

2/16/2025 9:04:22 pm

 

 

Other Possible Vulnerable Files

entry.title: Cloud Integration with Document AI
entry.content:
Introduction:

In this blog post, I will demonstrate how to connect Cloud Integration with Document AI. As a use case, let‚Äôs consider a scenario where a hospital registers a new patient, and the patient submits their previous prescription records. Using Document AI, we can extract relevant details such as past illnesses, allergies, and the patient‚Äôs blood group.

Document AI:

Step 1. As a pre-requisite, run a booster to activate Document AI in a trial account.  Reference link: Use Trial to Set Up Account for SAP Document AI and Get Service Key

Step 2. Create a custom schema as shown below.

Step 3. Upload sample prescriptions. Here, I have uploaded two prescriptions of a patient (merged into a single PDF). Please note that all the data is fictitious.

Step 4. Verify the extraction results, if required edit and then confirm.

For this example we get confidence percentage is 51%-80%. Please note, instant learning based on feedback is available on premium edition. Reference link: Instant Learning (Premium Edition)

Cloud Integration:

For the demo, I will send the PDF to Cloud Integration using an API testing tool. Cloud Integration will then forward it to Document AI, extract the results. 

The list of Document AI's APIs can be viewed using Swagger UI. The URL for swagger can be constructed from the Service key in the format: <tenantuiurl><swagger>

To call the Document AI API to post documents, use the below API.

The content modifier is used to set the options as below.

The groovy script is used to create the multipart/form-data format. The endpoint for the 1st call is <tenantuiurl><swagger>document/jobs

The response structure of the 1st call is shown below:

Retrieve the id and use the looping processing call option to get the extraction result once the job is completed.

Use the endpoint for 2nd call to get the extraction result:<tenantuiurl><swagger>document/jobs/<id>

The groovy script is used to retrieve the field values where the confidence level is more than 60%, and format the response.

Test the iFlow endpoint using API testing tool (as shown below).

Please note that all the data are fictitious.

Conclusion:

This blog post demonstrates a prototype that integrates Document AI for real life use cases along with Cloud Integration. 

Reference Link: SAP Document AI

entry.title: Re: Handling Late Variant Configuration Changes in Assemb...
entry.content:
You can assign Configurable Materials as network activity components directly in PS and the configurator will pop-up.

You can use non-valuated project stock components for long lead materials but you have to watch the WBS assignment on the raw materials and the manufactured materials to make sure they are the same otherwise you will get double ordering on the different WBS elements.  With Non-Val stock you will also see big cost variances on the production order since the raw material will post quantity only to the PP order without value.

entry.title: Re: The non-valuation of inter-projects and intra-project...
entry.content:
1.  Is the material maintained as Valuated or Non-Valuated Project Stock?  Check the Project Definition for the stock valuation setting.  If it is Non-Valuated Stock then value movements are manual via a journal entry.  EDIT: you said this is in S/4HANA Public Cloud, correct?  There is no Non-Valuated Project Stock in Public Cloud.

2.  Why Movement Types 343 and 344?  Those are for moving between blocked stock to unrestricted.  I have used 415Q to move from WBS to WBS.

entry.title: Re: Rise issue with Personas flavor authorization
entry.content:
If the flavors work as expected with SAP_ALL authorization profile but are not applied with something else assigned, then it seems pretty clear that the problem is on the authorization side. Without looking in the system, I cannot tell you what exactly causes the issue but that's where I'd look.

The reason for not seeing authorization problems in SU53 is that in runtime mode, we are trying to avoid filling up the authorization log with eventual failed authorization check messages for users who have no Personas access assigned and determine the user's authorizations in an alternate way.

entry.title: Re: Showing wrong attachment document in SAP MM
entry.content:
Hi @pratik_soni6 

Based on your last comments, this issue usually stems from a mapping or linkage problem in the integration chain between Ariba and SAP. I would suggest you proceed doing the following:

First you should confirm uniqueness and correctness of your document IDs and filenames in Ariba, ensure that there is no crossover in references within the outbound payload.

Then, make sure to validate the middleware mapping logic to ensure that the document name references correctly bind correctly to the matching file content without overwrites or mix-ups.

On the SAP side, investigate your attachment storage and linking, check for duplicate content IDs or incorrect metadata linking that may causes the wrong document to appear under a correct filename.

Proceed to perform controlled testing with distinct files and trace the full message payload from Ariba to SAP to pinpoint exactly where the mismatch occurs.

Please note, if you still experience the same problem after these steps, I suggest you engage SAP Support to review payload logs and mapping configurations in depth.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Autosubmission of empty timesheets
entry.content:
Hi @ManonH 

Thank you for your response.

To enable you cover untouched empty timesheets, you will need to create and assign a Time Sheet Submission Rule that explicitly includes criteria to auto-submit timesheets even when empty for your overtime recorders.

Please ensure this rule is linked to your Time Recording Submission Configuration and Time Recording Profile set for overtime recording type.

As mentioned earlier, you also have the option to use the Time Recording Calendar to trigger auto submissions on specific dates, independently of timesheet content.

If your current submission rule does not pick up empty timesheets, adjust it to ensure it explicitly includes those cases.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Short Dump error KE549 in CO-PA postings
entry.content:
We get ABAP dump during FI posting for new Company Code with error message KE549 in CO-PA posting.

ST22 Details

Cancelled Program:  RK2A0010_UPDATE

Application Component: CO-PA-PMS

Long text of error message:
 Diagnosis
     An undefined status has been discovered in the data basis for
     Profitability Analysis (CO-PA). The system cannot continue
     processing.
     Aids in diagnosing the problem:
     DIAG1 = "FBB1"
     DIAG2 = "0010"
     DIAG3 = "AUD"
     DIAG4 = "USD"

 Procedure
     Look in OSS for notes regarding error message KE549. The problem
     may have already be known.
     If you do not find a note, open a problem message in OSS and
     include the following information:
     o   What did you do to get this error? Indicate the transaction
         code, menu steps, or executed program that led to this message.
     o   Indicate all the necessary entries you made on any selections
         screens or dialog boxes that might help reproduce the problem.
     o   Make a note of the values listed above (DIAG1 through DIAG4).
     o   If this message appears in a short dump, specify the system and
         the application server in which you received the dump.

 Technical information about the message:
 Message class....... "KE"
 Number.............. 549
 Variable 1.......... "FBB1"
 Variable 2.......... 0010
 Variable 3.......... "AUD"
 Variable 4.......... "USD"

We found an OSS Note related to this dump - 1746096 - Short Dump with KE549 in CO-PA postings.  This note mentions about Pilot note 2377261.

  • Apply Pilot note 2377261. Please contact SAP Support if you would like to be added to the pilot note.

entry.title: Re: add data variable option is disabled in sap build apps
entry.content:
Hello @Aslam 

The Add Data Variable button in SAP Build Apps remains disabled because no Data Resource has been connected yet. To enable it, go to the Data tab, add a data source such as OData, REST API, or Google Sheets, then select an entity and load its schema. After completing these steps, you can go back to Variables ‚Üí Data Variables, and the option will become active.

 Creating Data Variables 

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: DI API Problem Class COM with SAP Business One Applic...
entry.content:
Hello @Tarik15 

Thanks for sharing , this COM class registration problem with SAP Business One DI API often happens when both 32-bit and 64-bit versions are installed. The system might bind to the 32-bit library even for 64-bit applications, leading to runtime errors.

Key takeaway: align the DI API bitness with your application, and if both versions are required, manage COM registration or use isolated environments to avoid conflicts.

Let me know if it helps

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Negative Posting on Internal Order After Asset Capita...
entry.content:
Hello @MAZIZ 

This is standard behaviour when an internal order is assigned to an asset master in ECC.

The reason it happens,

  • When you allocate post-acquisition costs directly to an Asset Under Construction (AUC) using an internal order, the CO actuals on that order are updated.
  • During capitalisation, SAP adjusts the AUC to match the final asset value. This process automatically posts a credit (negative entry) on the internal order for the settled amount, which reverses those CO actuals. As a result, the available budget appears to have increased.
  • The idea is that the internal order acts as a temporary accumulation point for costs; once these costs are capitalised, they are removed from the CO.

Optional Best practice

If the internal order is solely for monitoring and should not be refunded on capitalization, do not assign it in the asset master. Instead, record costs through postings to the order directly.

If you need to retain the link, modify CO reports (such as S_ALR_87013019) to exclude settlement transactions with business transaction code KOAO, ensuring they do not distort the data budget.

Use a WBS element in Investment Management for multi-asset projects. It manages partial capitalisation more effectively than internal orders with multiple assets.

G/L Accounts and Cost Elements for Settlement. 

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Innovation Adoption in ERP Systems in Portugal
entry.content:
Current ERP Adoption Landscape in Portugal

1. High ERP Penetration

Portugal stands out as one of the European leaders in ERP adoption. In 2021, 52% of Portuguese companies were already using ERP software ‚Äî well above the EU average of 40.5%. This places the country second only to Belgium (57%) and ahead of Spain (49%). newoxygen.com

2. Cloud Migration

According to the study ‚ÄúSoftware de Gest√£o em Portugal e Tecnologias Digitais em 2021‚Äù (newoxygen.com), only around 35% of Portuguese companies host their ERP in the cloud. This adoption rate, however, is significantly above the European Union average of 24% in the same context. This gap highlights Portugal‚Äôs willingness to embrace cloud technology faster than most of its EU counterparts, opening the door for next-generation ERP solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

3. Regulatory Drivers

Legal requirements ‚Äî such as certified invoicing software and QR codes on invoices ‚Äî have pushed many SMEs to invest in compliant ERP systems. Around 50% of companies are acquiring, upgrading, or considering acquiring ERP systems. 

Innovation in Advanced ERP Solutions

1. Banking Connectivity in Portugal

  • The integration between SAP and banking systems has become more professional: SAP promotes the Multi-Bank Connectivity (MBC) solution to simplify connections to multiple banks (supports SWIFT, EBICS, etc.) and has documentation and use cases for adoption in S/4HANA environments.. SAP+1
  • In Portugal, there are already initiatives and technical presentations showing real cases of innovation in banking connectivity with SAP, implemented by Makevalue (references at local events and in the SAP Portugal community).Comunidade SAP
  • Portuguese banks (e.g., Millennium bcp) provide direct integration channels (APIs / "Direct Channel") and documentation for integration with ERP systems. These capabilities enable SAP customers to develop secure and automatic connections between S/4HANA and local banking services (payments, statements, reconciliation)... millenniumbcp.ptfintable.io
  • Another possibility is the implementation of SIBS APIs, whose connectivity partner certification occurs through its SIBS Lab projects. A successful certification project with SAP already exists, developed by Makevalue (partner SAP build)

2. SAP Adoption and Notable Projects

  • Grow with SAP ‚Äî A cloud-based ERP solution designed for SMEs, offering sector-specific best practices and continuous updates. Adopted by 440 companies in 80 countries, including ~10 in Portugal. Examples:
    • Casa Mendes Gon√ßalves adopted SAP S/4HANA Cloud to boost operational agility and real-time data integration.
    • Softinsa (IBM subsidiary) was the first SAP partner in Portugal to implement S/4HANA Cloud internally, modernizing finance, procurement, and operations.
  • Portuguese companies embracing SAP S/4HANA for next-gen business process management include Carris, Lactogal, Lusiaves, and Sogrape.
  • Public sector adoption is notable: Comboios de Portugal and Metropolitano de Lisboa implemented SAP HANA as their digital core, enabling instant insights and real-time analytics.
  • In the Customer Experience space, R√°dio Popular adopted SAP C/4HANA for a unified customer view.
  • In Human Capital Management, Grupo Nabeiro and Grupo Pestana implemented SAP SuccessFactors.

3. SAP Partner Ecosystem in Portugal

Portugal hosts a mix of global and local SAP partners, including Inetum, MINSAIT, Seidor, SNP, NTT DATA, valantic (√Åbaco), Softinsa/IBM, and multinational consultancies such as Accenture and Deloitte. Several alliances have been announced to accelerate S/4HANA migrations (e.g., Seidor+SNP).

There is no recent public figure for the exact number of SAP partners active in Portugal. However, SAP‚Äôs Partner Finder tool can be filtered by country and partner type to produce an accurate list.

Summary Table

Phenomenon

Situation in Portugal

Source

ERP Adoption

High (52% of companies; above EU average)

newoxygen.com

Cloud ERP Usage

In 2021, 35% of Portuguese companies host their ERP in the cloud

Newoxygen.com

SME Adoption

Driven by regulation and digital needs

Octa Code

AI in ERP

Present (Cegid Pulse promoting generative AI)

digitalinside.sapo.pt

Modern Cloud Solutions (e.g., SAP)

Ongoing adoption (Grow with SAP, S/4HANA Cloud)

SAP News Center

The Bottom Line

Portugal has a mature ERP adoption landscape, bolstered by regulatory pressures and digital transformation needs. Innovation is accelerating, particularly in cloud and AI-driven ERP systems. SAP plays a central role, with a solid partner ecosystem (around 50 companies in Portugal) and high-profile migration projects to S/4HANA.

The sectors with the largest SME presence include wholesale/retail, agriculture, accommodation & food services, healthcare & social assistance, and construction. In 2022, 80% of new SAP software contracts in Portugal were with SMEs ‚Äî underscoring SAP‚Äôs strong alignment with the country‚Äôs business fabric.

References:

  • SAP News Center ‚Äì Grow with SAP helps SMEs grow
  • SAP News Center ‚Äì Casa Mendes Gon√ßalves adopts Grow with SAP
  • SAP News Center ‚Äì Softinsa bets on S/4HANA Cloud
  • Eurostat ‚Äì E-business Integration
  • SAP Portugal Partners
  • Bank Conectivity with SAP

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: CAL Software license
entry.content:
The reason for this warning message "License Keys for tenant systems are not supported‚Äù is that most cloud products do not require the generation of a license key for activation or upgrade. Only a few cloud products, such as BOBJ, require applying for a license key within the license key app.

Typically, for cloud products, customers only need to purchase the relevant product license to obtain the corresponding product tenants, without the need to apply for an additional license key.

After my investigation in the backend system, I found that your company's account currently has Pay-as-you-go type BTP licenses, which are similar to a trial package.

If you need to continue using the BTP system/tenant, you will need to contact your Account Manager representative for further assistance. 

Related KBAs:

2626344 - Who is the SAP Account Manager for my company?

3259711 - Who to contact at SAP for contract and/or licensing questions - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: SAP S4/Hana Cloud Public, define validation rules: co...
entry.content:
Hello @rekafulop 

There is a restriction in using G/L account hierarchy nodes in filters in validation rule definition. The following are not supported yet:

  • Use of special nodes such as Net Result: Loss, Net Result: Profit, and P&L Result .
  • Nodes that are set to contra nodes of other FSV nodes. 
  • Duplicate G/L accounts due to settings such as contra node, bank account grouping, and reclassification increment.

This is because these nodes contain special calculation logic that is not yet supported in the validation run. You can use other FSV nodes or the nodes from G/L account hierarchies (the hierarchies with prefix H109 in the IDs). See more in help: Create Basic Rules.

Thanks for the question!

Grace

let changedObjects = context.getControl('SectionedTable0').getSection('SectionDataTable0').getChanges();
let message = JSON.stringify(changedObjects);

entry.title: Re: NFC scanning in SAP MDK for Android.
entry.content:
We don't offer out of the box NFC support.  It can be done but will depend on what you are looking to do.  Are you planning on just using the NFC capabilities of most every Android device or are you looking to use something else (specialized device, external hardware scanner, etc)?

There is a Nativescript plugin (nativescript-nfc) but it would need to be updated to be compatible with the latest MDK versions.  The plugin is community provided so updates are not in our direct control.  There are also some forks of the repo you could also investigate that may have been updated.

Alternatively you could create your own plugin to enable the NFC scanning as well.  MDK also introduced the ability to override the default scanning button for search and simple property fields where you could call the NFC scanning instead of the default camera scanning.

entry.title: how to find more Information about a Business Key Figure Alert in the EarlyWatch Alert
entry.content:
Order To Cash:  Overdue Outbound Deliveries [K11]  
Order To Cash:  Deliveries with overdue invoices [K12]  
Order To Cash:  Orders not billed (Order related billing) [K06] 
Order To Cash:  Orders billed not delivered [K07]   
Order To Cash:  Sales Order Schedule Line Items overdue [K04]   


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: how to find more Information about a Business Key Fig...
entry.content:
Each of the Key Figures that appear in the EWA report can be mapped to an Object ID, you can check the below Object IDs mapping.
Order To Cash:  Overdue Outbound Deliveries [K11]  KPLE000110
Order To Cash:  Deliveries with overdue invoices [K12]  KPLE000114
Order To Cash:  Orders not billed (Order related billing) [K06]  KPSD000123
Order To Cash:  Orders billed not delivered [K07]   KPSD000122
Order To Cash:  Sales Order Schedule Line Items overdue [K04]   KPSD000303 

To find more Information about a Business Key Figure Alert in the EarlyWatch Alert (EWA), please use the Object ID as the Monitoring Object input in transaction ST13 - tool name: TBI_REPORTS in the managed system.
For more detailed steps, please refer the step 15-step 21 mentioned in KBA 3401587 - How To Find More Information About a Business Key Figure Alert in the EarlyWatch Alert (EWA) 

And please also refer to Point #3 in KBA 2197502:
In case you would like to get more details about a Key Figure that was highlighed in EWA, SAP Readiness Check 2.0, Next Generation SAP Business Scenario Recommendations or SAP Innovation and Optimization Pathfinder, you should setup Business Process Analytics and perform deeper analysis with the functions available within BPIMp. You can contact your SAP Account representative to request more information about the available services. Please check the Business Process Improvement wiki page here.

entry.title: Re: Short Dump error KE549 in CO-PA postings
entry.content:
The ABAP dump you're encountering during FI posting in a new company code‚Äîtriggered by error message KE549 in CO-PA‚Äîis due to an undefined or invalid program state in the profitability analysis interface. Specifically, the system fails to process the CO-PA segment because the underlying data basis or configuration is incomplete or inconsistent.
This typically occurs when the CO-PA interface program cannot resolve the correct profitability segment or value field mapping during actual value flow.

SAP Note 1746096 identifies the root cause of KE549 dumps during CO-PA postings and recommends applying a pilot correction and SAP Pilot Note 2377261 is a restricted-access note that contains the actual fix for the KE549 dump. You must request SAP Support to be added to the pilot note. It‚Äôs not publicly downloadable.

Action:

  • Open an incident with SAP Support referencing Note 1746096 and request access to Pilot Note 2377261.
  • Include the full ST22 dump and the DIAG values (FBB1, 0010, AUD, USD) in your incident.
  • SAP will evaluate and either grant access to the pilot note or provide a workaround.

entry.title: Re: How to post noted items in S4H Cloud
entry.content:
SAP‚Äôs Scope Item 2NZ ‚Äì Bank Guarantee Management supports this functionality in Public Cloud. It includes:

  • Issuing and receiving guarantees
  • Tracking expiry and due dates
  • Integration with Receivables Management

You can explore it further in SAP‚Äôs Best Practice documentation here

entry.title: Re: Cash Journal
entry.content:
The Cash Journal in SAP offers several practical and strategic benefits, especially for organizations that handle frequent petty cash or manual cash transactions. Here's a breakdown of its main advantages:

  • All cash receipts and payments are recorded in one place. Simplifies monitoring of daily cash activities.
  • SAP automatically ensures that the cash balance cannot go negative, helping maintain financial discipline.
  • You can view the opening and closing balances instantly. Supports better liquidity management and decision-making.
  • Cash journal entries are transferred to the General Ledger in a controlled manner. Reduces manual errors and ensures consistency in accounting.
  • Transactions can be analyzed by day, week, or month. Supports audit readiness and financial transparency.
  • Single-screen transaction for entering, displaying, and editing entries. Supports printing of receipts and journal summaries.

entry.title: Re: How can i change batch in EWM outbound Delivery if th...
entry.content:
Yes you are correct. CHBA works only if the batch was selected by EWM, not if it was predefined in ERP and passed into EWM via the outbound delivery. If you're working with a client who insists on batch flexibility, consider adjusting the delivery creation logic in ERP to omit batch assignment, allowing EWM to take control.

Below is the suggested approach

entry.title: Re: How to prevent express item from being sent to sap inbox
entry.content:
SAP does not provide a standard personal setting to stop Express Work Items from appearing in the inbox. These items are designed to grab attention immediately and bypass normal inbox filters.

Since you don't want to lower the priority, you have to explore custom validation via BAdI WF_BWP_SELECT_FILTER which allows filtering of work items shown in the inbox. You can implement logic to exclude specific Express Work Items based on user, task, or context.
If the user should not receive the work item, adjust the agent rules to exclude them. This is especially useful when substitutes are active.
If you're dealing with substitutes and both primary and substitute users are receiving Express Work Items, that‚Äôs standard SAP behavior. You‚Äôd need to remove the primary user from agent determination Or use filtering logic in the BAdI to suppress delivery to the primary user.

entry.title: Re: IW36: Copying Settlement Rules in the Child Order
entry.content:
You're using IW36 via BDC to create a child PM order from a superior order, and you want to copy the settlement rules from the superior order into the child order before it's created, ideally within the IF_EX_WORKORDER_UPDATE~AT_SAVE method of the BAdI.

The key constraints are

  • The method AT_SAVE is triggered after the order is created, not before.
  • At the time this method runs, the child order number is already assigned.
  • The BAdI interface IF_EX_WORKORDER_UPDATE provides limited importing parameters‚Äîmainly the order number and some header data.

What you can do is use AT_SAVE to Copy Settlement Rules. You can read the superior order using AUFK or COBRB tables. Then copy its settlement rules into the newly created child order using function modules like:

  • K_SETTLEMENT_RULE_READ
  • K_SETTLEMENT_RULE_SAVE

This works only if the child order is already created and has a valid order number.

Alternatively, if you need to intervene before the order is created, consider:

  • User Exit IWO10009 ‚Äì for PM order creation.
  • Enhancement Point in IW36 screen logic ‚Äì if you control the BDC flow.
